title: John Paulson Looks to Sell into Puerto Rico’s Hotel Boom
sub_head: Owners aim to cash in as the pandemic boosts the island’s tourism and real-estate market
body:
Some of Puerto Rico’s most prominent hotels are going on the market as owners look to cash in on the island’s strong tourism and real-estate market boosted by the pandemic.
Hedge-fund manager and real estate owner John Paulson, who has invested heavily in Puerto Rico in recent years, is testing the market for the Condado Vanderbilt Hotel and La Concha Renaissance San Juan Resort through real-estate firm JLL, according to people familiar with the matter.
